subject: Re: [junit] How do I click on javascript links and get the  resulting URL.
msgSnippet: This looks like HTTPUnit. I suggest posting on an HTTPUnit list, too. I use HTMLUnit, so I can t help you. Last time I used HTTPUnit it had ZERO support for
messageBody:
This looks like HTTPUnit. I suggest posting on an HTTPUnit list, too. I
use HTMLUnit, so I can't help you.

Last time I used HTTPUnit it had ZERO support for Javascript.

Good luck.

So said nimble_peter <peter@...> on 2003-01-30
--------------------

>Here is my code:
>WebLink[] linkList = response.getLinks();
>System.out.println(linkList[0].getURLString());
>
>The above line of code returns
>
>javascript:window.open
>('/proc/case_sny.jsp','case','width=650,height=410,toolbar=no,scrollba
>rs=no,resizable=no');void(0);
>
>Question: How do I click on this javascript link.
>
>
>The call:
>WebResponse linkresp = linkList[0].click();
>
>Gives me a null pointer exception
>
>I want to be able to then call the following line of code:
>System.out.println(linkresp.getURL().toString());
>
>Peter Phelan.
>
